meanings.definition: To make a photocopy using a Xerox machine.
meanings.sent1: I will xerox this document for you.
meanings.sent2: She always xeroxes important papers before meetings.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to xerox the mysterious letter for evidence.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to xerox the image of her smile, holding it vividly.
meanings.sent5: The copier hummed softly as it began to xerox the pages.

meanings.definition: A brand of photocopying machine or a photocopy made using such a machine.
meanings.sent1: The office purchased a new Xerox for faster copying.
meanings.sent2: He made a xerox of the contract for his records.
meanings.sent3: The Xerox in the corner seemed to be winking at me.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a Xerox of joy.
meanings.sent5: The old Xerox whirred to life, ready to duplicate the report.
